} } } Length:: 1:31 Mins Sony DSC-TX30/B 18 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.3-Inch OLED (Black)I have used several brands of digital cameras. Samsung, Panasonic, Nikon, Kodak, GE, Fujifilm and now Sony, Some of these cameras were intimidating to learn how to use but the thrill of a new camera meeting my needs overrode that. The Sony DSC-TX30/B, however, was simple to learn and a lot of fun.I like certain features and how the camera works in certain situations, i.e., zoom, low light etc.The interface that this camera has is very easy to utilize and this also has a user guide to refer to as you are using the camera functions. It is extremely convenient. You don't have to carry a manual with you.The OLED screen is fantastic. Better than any camera I have used up to this point. A drawback of no view finder is that is it hard to see the screen in bright sunlight. I did have trouble seeing what I was shooting and recording but the screen is large enough that when you aim, it's hard to miss. I was pretty happy with the coverage I shot.With this Sony DSC-X30, this camera has features that I have never had before. This camera is waterproof up to 33 feet for 60 minutes (make sure to follow proper before and after care directions) which is quite exciting. I have always wanted to take pictures in the pool and in the ocean. This is also dust and sand proof allowing for even more flexibility. The best part and a feature I need is that this is shockproof from falls of up to 5 feet. I hope to not have to try out this feature but I am very happy that I have it with this camera.One other thing I found while using this camera is that I found my fingers in the way of the lens while capturing video, even when my kids used it they inadvertently did too, so be aware of the placement of your hands.A plus for me is that when I wanted to view my pictures on my TV or computer I could use the micro cable that came with my Kindle Fire HD. Check the length of your cable though to make sure it is long enough to reach your TV or computer from the power source.This camera uses a MS Micro, Memory Stick Micro (Mark 2) and is Micro SD/Micro SDHC Compatible. This camera does have some internal memory but not for a video. I think 28 pictures at the best quality is about all the internal memory can hold. So make sure to have an external card so you can shoot as many pictures and videos as you need.Some of the advanced features for this camera areAnti-Motion BlurSweep Panorama: Underwater Sweep Panorama / Intelligent Sweep Panorama (360)Face Detection: 8 facesSmile Shutter(tm) technologyImage Stabilization: Optical Steady Shot(tm) Image Stabilization with Active modeIn-Camera Editing: Beauty Effect / Trimming / Unsharp Masking / Date view / Picture Effect-Picture Effects: HDR Painting / Rich tone Monochrome / Miniature / Toy camera / Pop Color / Partial color / Soft High-key / Watercolor / IllustrationAfter you take a picture you can go into "Menu" and select "paint", then you can draw, add little stamps to picture's you've taken. Its loads of fun!Intelligent AutoBackground DefocusWaterproofDustproofFreeze proofShockproofSuperior AutoTracking Focus: Off / AutoAndBlink Detection This camera fits in the palm of my hand and is very light weight, easy to learn and the most important; fun to use!This camera also comes with access to Play Memories Home. "Play Memories Home" is a software suite that enables you to import videos and photos to a computer, and then browse and manage them."I included a short video (This will capture video in 29 minute segments) and if you have any questions about this camera, post a comment and I will respond as soon as possible. Also Sony support at support dot sony dot com has how to videos to help you. [...]

Reviews.Title: Another Mixed Bag
Reviews.Author: Bradford Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera. It's small, sexy, waterproof and shockproof, shoots hi-def movies, has a 5X optical zoom and has a great set of features. Sadly, this one misses on delivering where it's really important.From a feature standpoint, as I mentioned, it's great. The software and shooting modes are close to those on the Sony DSC-HX300, which I reviewed and loved. The Enhanced Super Auto mode is really, really good, handling almost any shooting situation with few problems. The program modes are also excellent, with some really fun features like partial color and panorama mode (which works GREAT).Macro is incredibly good for a point-and-shoot. You can turn off the flash and use two small LED illumination rings around the lens to avoid flash-nastiness, and I've shot photos from an inch away that are sharp and clear - really quite stunning on that level.Underwater shots are great as well - I've taken it in my pool as well as in the ocean, and the photos came out quite nice. I wouldn't try to shoot wearing diving gloves though - they're way too clunky and the controls on the camera are way too cramped.Photo quality is pretty good, but Sony has set the software up to over-sharpen a bit too much, resulting in high noise levels. The flash is good but not amazing, and again the extra noise is there making its presence known when you blow things up. However, if you're looking for snapshots that aren't going to be used in National Geographic, or you aren't planning on printing and framing 11x16-inch photos, you're in pretty good hands here. Of course, in order to see photos you need to be able to TAKE photos... and that's that's where things start to fall apart: ergonomics and functionality.First of all, the lens is placed SO close to the corner of the camera that it's quite tough to get a comfortable grip on the thing without either a) getting a finger in the shot or b) hitting one of the controls on the back panel. It's bizarre, really - I don't know how no one noticed how easy it is to put a finger in the shot just trying to hold the thing comfortably.And holding it is made even tougher because there's no room on the back for one's thumb, due to the large OLED touch-sensitive screen. By the way, I have pretty average-sized hands: they aren't Tyrannosaurus rex-small, but they aren't palm-a-basketball-large, either. Regardless, it's just too awkward to hold and control this thing without running into problems. Again, the features are dandy, but using them (or finding a comfortable way to hold the camera) can be a bear.Another problem with the OLED screen: it's particularly problematic in bright sunlight. At anything less than full, battery-draining brightness, the display is almost useless on a sunny day. Sure, the photo can be framed (basically) but adjusting menus is almost impossible due to low legibility.Even with all of those issues, I was still prepared to like this little guy for what it was: a tough, compact camera to be tossed in a bag or pocket and taken on adventures or to dinner or a club. Sadly, the LCD panel is plastic and scratches WAY too easily to take full advantage of its supposed shock and dust proofness (yeah, that's not even a word, I know). Mine's already marked up and I've never had it in a pocket or bag (without a case). I don't even have a clue how it happened. Not good.Then things go from "bummer" to "oh, c'mon, no way" when it's time to shoot movies. At first I was pleased with it. Movies are easily recorded using a dedicated movie button, and stills can be taken while you're shooting. After transferring to my computer, I was happy with how they looked, too.Until I turned up the volume. There's a disturbingly loud, high-pitched noise in the background constantly. It sounds like a cross between crickets chirping and bacon frying (so I get bummed out and hungry at the same time). You can still hear the sounds you've recorded, but that background sound is so distracting and loud in the quiet passages that I can't stand to watch anything I've shot. I've tested this in both AVCHD and MP4 mode and the issue is the same.To be fair, this could be an issue with my particular camera. I'll contact Sony and see what's what. But it's off-putting enough for me that had I purchased it (I received a review unit) I wouldn't bother with a replacement, I'd just flat return it.So, in the end, we're left with a camera that looks quite beautiful, works well underwater, can be dropped without breaking (untested, sorry!), has a fantastic macro mode and takes pretty good photos. Unfortunately the OLED screen isn't up to the toughness level of the rest of the thing and it's a pain to actually USE. Plus, in mine at least, it's got an unusable movie recording mode. I'm rating this 4 stars based on rounding up from 3.5 (which is where I'd place it were I able), thanks to its ability to shoot underwater. Were it not for that, I'd be rounding down to 3.Sorry, Sony but as sexy as this thing looks, it's not the one I'd marry.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for clinical photos
Reviews.Author: J Davis
Reviews.Content: While the ruggedized features of this camera are very nice, they are simply icing on the cake to the real standout feature for me -- the magnifying glass plus mode. The bright LEDs surrounding the lens aperture and the short macro distance allows me to take amazingly detailed, close up images during clinic. The zoom even allows magnification up to 15x. The only other cameras I found with these features were much larger and did not fit in my white coat as easily. The ruggedness makes me feel a bit better about having it in close proximity to blood and other bodily fluids, but this is really just a bonus to the small size and macro mode. I've only used it for a few days but it starts up quickly, has taken sharp photos, and has satisfied my every need for this purpose. If you are looking for a compact camera to use for clinical photos, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-TX30 A wonderful small camera to take everywhere
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace an earlier version that I lost on vacation in November, since I liked the one I lost so much. While there are some changes in the interface for choosing shooting options, it remains an easy to use camera that takes very good photos. I've also used it to record videos that have been helpful in reviewing music/dance for a cabaret I'm in. I particularly like its option for taking photos with a "high speed shutter". When a passenger in a car, it makes surprisingly good pictures taken while the car is moving--great when I'm on vacation overseas. It is advertised as shock-proof, which I inadvertently tested the 2nd day I had the camera by dropping it onto a wooden floor from a height of 3 feet--the camera still works fine. The macro feature also makes close-up photos easy to take. My one complaint is the parallax apparent in some photos, particularly if there are distinct vertical features in the scene being photographed. Many friends have been impressed by the camera and the photos I've taken with it.

Reviews.Title: Low light picture quality is NOT satisfied.
Reviews.Author: EUNGSUK YI
Reviews.Content: Low light picture quality is NOT satisfied.This may be good for out-door camera where bright light is required for better quality of picture.

Reviews.Title: The most versatile TX ever!
Reviews.Author: no_name
Reviews.Content: In total I've bought 4 TX models: TX1, TX30, TX70, TX300, TX20 and TX30.From the first to the last I like the slim and elegant design and the improved GUI of every generation.What I like on my TX30:- large, bright and sharp touch display- fast switch on, response and trigger times (for a compact camera)- configurable menus- easy to operate graphical user interface (GUI)- robust design (water, dust and shock proof)- micro USB interface for charging and data exchange.- manual white balance functionWhat I don't like on my TX30:- Questionable BIONZ image improvements. For instance: I cannot make sharp images of the moon anymore as I could make with older generations without BIONZ.- Useless 18MPixel sensor: The effective image resolution is much lower!What I miss on my TX30:- live histogram function like the first generations have had.- more manual controls as professionals cameras have.- Better image quality for higher resolutions.What are the unique selling points for me?- real, slim (lady-like) pocket size format- magnifying function with with build-in LED light illumination! Because I am using the camera every day for quality control. Because it is so much better than my own eyes...I really hope that SONY is continuing the TX series in future ...

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my purpose
Reviews.Author: A. Maddox
Reviews.Content: I need a rugged camera that can slip into my pocket and open up with one hand. This does the job real well. Low level light is good as well. It sucks in as much light as it can. This does cause a slight delay when it's processing the pic, but the pics come out great. the video works equally as well in low light and can take stills at the same time. Awesome..

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Leung
Reviews.Content: Got the camera and returned immediately.  First immediate problem is the memory card error.  It seems like I am not the only getting this error.  Through Google search, a lot of people experienced the same type of error.  The error code is C13:01 for memory reading error. This uses the SD Micro card.  I know for sure there is nothing wrong with the card because it works on my other cameras.I will never buy another Sony camera ever again.  Sony makes terrible cameras.  I think Sony's reputation is going down the hill.  The built quality of the camera is not even that good, seems too delicate.  I would highly recommend Panasonic Lumix, Nikon Coolpix, Olympus Tough, and even Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great Slim Camera that i sshock and water proof.
Reviews.Author: Hotel Bravo
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great.It takes great pictures in and out of the pool as well as okay pictures under the water. Great video quality too, even though it seems that video will suck the battery down quickly. Camera is very quick, except when you are zoomed in on a subject, it takes a few seconds for the picture to process.Only complaints:Wow it's slick/slippery to hold. Sony could also have done a better job with an adjustable wristband that you could tighten around your wrist. The wristband doesn not tighten. Camea has no viewfinder, but aren't all these compact point-and-shoots going that way?  The shutter button is vey small, but again this is a very compact camera. People won't believe that it's water proof.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Roxie
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera, worked every where, even fell int he pool and worked with out any issues. Love this camera, would definitely recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: Error C 13:01
Reviews.Author: Christian Ramírez
Reviews.Content: Terrible purchase... First try to insert the memory I get an error c 13:01... Tried all troubleshooting steps and didn't do any good.

Reviews.Title: is this real Sony product?
Reviews.Author: Pen P.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera over a month ago.  Using it a few times on trips to take pictures and the pictures are looking OK.  However, when it ran out of battery today and I tried to charge it, charger came with the device would not fit into the camera.  This make me wonder if this is really a Sony product.  Charger would not fit a camera is just too obvious of a mistake to me for a company like Sony.  Other problem that I have every now and then is that the camera kept saying that there are no more memory and I know that there should still be a lot of memory left since I have 32 Gb in it.  I have to take the memory out and put it back in again to resolve that problem.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Frank Phelan
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, had for a little over a month and the latch to the battery that holds it in place broke off. Even though this wasnt an Amazon return / issue Sony was very easy to work with getting it repaired.

Reviews.Title: Camera OK - But don't count on Sony Service
Reviews.Author: Patrick Barnett
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera and took it on a vacation to Hawaii for some shallow underwater snorkeling pictures.  Never exceeded the limit and camera seeped water.  Tried to get Sony to honor their warranty and the people at the service center were so rude, I will never by another Sony product as long as I live.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Suitably rugged for a trip.
Reviews.Author: Marquez Herrod
Reviews.Content: Before i bought this camera i was a little concerned about a lot of the reviews that said it had issues with leaking when used underwater, and that Sony's support was terrible. Well i took this camera on a trip to Puerto Rico for a week right after i received it. I didn't buy any special accessories, i just used it as-is. I can say that this guy functioned wonderfully both in and out of the water. I used it every single day on the beach, in the rainforest, and out at night.I would say on average i was taking somewhere in the neighborhood of about 100 or so pictures and 3 or 4 videos per day. At that rate i ran out of juice only one time and that was at about 11PM after being out all day since about 9AM. So I would have to say the battery life was pretty good. Also i used this in the water ALOT! I took both pics and videos and it was great to use some of the more artistic settings such as sketch mode underwater; it really allowed me to document my trip in a much more detailed way since i could take it literally everywhere i went without having to worry about ruining it.I never once had any water get into the case, after a couple of particularly long sessions in the water it did prompt me with a warning on startup about making sure the battery cover was closed properly, but that was the extent of it. The picture quality was also damn good for the size of the camera and definitely much better than my iPhone 5 i was carrying.Overall, an excellent camera for the price. And if you are looking for something you can literally throw in your pocket and take with you everywhere, this is it. Just don't expect DSLR quality pics.

Reviews.Title: Died after submersion in water
Reviews.Author: gentai
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics.  Generations better than the previous TX20.  BUT, it died after its first dip in the pool.  I checked the battery compartment and found no trace of any leak.  Water must have seeped in elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: laura
Reviews.Author: laura miller
Reviews.Content: I won this camera in a Sweepstakes and loved it so I bought one for my son. Easy to use and excellent photo quality

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the beach and any vacation!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This camera was perfect for my trip to Costa Rica. I took it to the beach with me and used it in the water. The pictures turned out great! The outside has a few scratches on it from being rubbed up against rocks, but it still functions perfectly. I would DEFINITELY recommend this camera to friends, family, and strangers.

Reviews.Title: Best Waterproof Cam
Reviews.Author: Brienne
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this cam! This is the best vacay camera that money can buy! I never have to miss a beach shoot again!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Ralph G. Bullis "diverdude2"
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera to take some under water Salmon Video.  Found out the camera is a great little point and shoot camera.  You have to set the touch screen to maximum brightness for outdoors in the sun.  The menu system is pretty easy.  I leave it set to Intelligent Auto and the camera does the rest..

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Luisa M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing! I loved!The color I bought is really beatiful! I recommend for everybody... And the pictures under water are very very great

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Richard Weibel
Reviews.Content: I've only owned this camera for a week, but it was use extensively for a trip to Vegas! I was very impressed with how it reacted in all lighting situations. It was very fast to turn on, the touchscreen has great sensivtivity and most importantly the pictures turned out great! I have yet to test the camera under water and it hasn't been dropped yet so i can't speak to its ruggedness but so far i'm loving the camera!!I'll update the review once it's been used in more situations.

Reviews.Title: not really waterproof
Reviews.Author: globalgamble "KR"
Reviews.Content: After using it for less than a year, it has died on me.  I took it under water a few times, and it was fine.  Just recently I forgot was in my pocket when I jumped in a pool, and now it is ruined.  It is not holding up to the test of time.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Efrain
Reviews.Content: You won't need any other.  Still loving it.  Very intuitive to use, big screen, all you need to take great pictures.  But you'll have to tweak it a little bit.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Takes some stellar photos in low or high light. No complaints yet. Haven't had an opportunity to really test the waterproof feature. If it dies camping this summer I'll be sure to let you all know.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, great for underwater, panoramics, low light
Reviews.Author: David Woshinsky
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony before, and loved it, so had to go for another one!  It has great quality for an automatic camera, and photo quality is very good.  Plus the camera is very durable, shock proof, freeze proof, water proof, etc.  Good for the adventurous traveler like me!

Reviews.Title: Maybe I am out of touch...
Reviews.Author: Eric C. Sepci "ecseps"
Reviews.Content: But I am not sure what some people are complaining about when you get a good point and shoot camera that also take great pics under water.  This is not a "diving" camera, but one that works (and quite well mind you) when snorkeling or something similar.Waiting to actually use it before reviewing and I think the picture qualities in water are very good and out of water, are simply amazing, again, for a point and shoot.  For the money paid (under $200), the camera is a steal.  Used it for a week in Orlando - salt water reef pool, fresh water, night time shots, family pics - all done very well.  If you use in salt water - like anything else, make sure you rinse it well when done.Again, if you are realistic about what this camera is intended for, it is hard to beat at this price.  I feel bad for my larger SLR...this one is simply too easy to carry around and use....

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: calob snow
Reviews.Content: it has a lot of great features, the batteries last dam near forever and it takes all sorts of great photos

Reviews.Title: Best compact camera!
Reviews.Author: Merlene Daguerre Rezk
Reviews.Content: I 've had Sony T since i bought my first digital camera, and I can tell than the shots are fabulous!This new model is full, and you dont even need to carry a heavy machine just to take great photos.I love it!

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Bellhead
Reviews.Content: I wanted a tiny camera, and this one works fine. I like the movie button a lot--no menu fussing to start recording.It focuses and takes the photo much faster than my 6-year-old Casio and is nicely more compact.The photos are fine for me, nicely natural. It's more than I expected for the price.No buyer's remorse at all for me on this one.

Reviews.Title: Held up to skiing below zero and Mexico beaches
Reviews.Author: skudbucket
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take to my wedding in Mexico.  It was PERFECT for the job.  Hauled it around everywhere that I went.  Get sand on it.... just rinse it off!  Held up well under below freezing temperatures as well.  Awesome response on the touch screen.  The only time I had an issue was on the mountain when my hands were so cold they were numb.  Pictures are perfectly clear and the MANY picture settings are great fun to experiment with!  I highly highly highly recommend for somebody looking for a less expensive camera to take on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel Taban
Reviews.Content: As described even and really an excellent camera. I have been an admirer of Sony cameras and this is my third Sony DSC I have bought and the second in the T series category. Very stylish!

Reviews.Title: This Camera Rocks
Reviews.Author: George MacCrone
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box this camera was easy to use and fun.The Menu is easy to use once you get acclimatized to it, many fun features.Blur free pictures even though I know my hands were not still while I was running to get a better angle on a few shots.I also like the fact that I can take pictures with it in a storm and not ruin it by getting it wet.This camera is always with me.Its fast, trouble free and with the 32 Gb Micro SD card it holds all the video  and pictures I can take on an outing.

Reviews.Title: Best compact camera yet!
Reviews.Author: Peter "P&G;"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife, however, it's so good at taking video (and of course pictures) I ended up using it more than her!

Reviews.Title: Handy pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Cahn
Reviews.Content: I carried this camera earlier this month to Costa Rica and Panama.  I got it two days before my trip, and I read the instructions on the plane.  The camera worked flawlessly I took about 350 images from macro to scenery.  It was immerged several times and was hit once by a heavy rain.  I dropped it more than twice.  I am giving it to my grand daughter to use on a service trip to Gambia.  I couldn't find another one. How sad

Reviews.Title: Excellent underwater pictures
Reviews.Author: Greg C. "Greg"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Small size, waterproof, speedy start up, good quality under water pics, great video quality, both above and below the water.  Touch screen worked well, but above water only.Cons: in some outdoor sunny conditions it was difficult to see the display.  No touch screen functions underwater.Overall, this is an excellent camera.  We took it on a beach vacation and it is very durable and works well above and below the water.  Very compact, with a ton of features, including an awesome panorama function.  Video quality was very impressive.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: solifatkid
Reviews.Content: great pictures for such a small camera. options to clean up/clear up pictures are a nice plus. Motion detection and stills are easy to use. I especially love the fact that you can program to focus on children rather than adult and smile detection.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Raylee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for someone who is going to Alaska for a cruise. It is waterproof, touch screen, and has a panoramic feature which clinched it for me. The software is intuitive and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot I've owned!
Reviews.Author: Sean Davis
Reviews.Content: I have owned a lot of different cameras and currently own 2 DSLR's and this point and shoot.  I love that it is waterproof and it takes great pictures even in low light.  Best pocket camera I know of and perfect for traveling.  I purchased 2 already...one as a gift and one for me!  Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Incredible this camera is definitely worth purchasing
Reviews.Author: Gary M.
Reviews.Content: I will recommend this camera to anyone who enjoy taking  different shots. Quality is fantastic. Must say in this small compact camera photos come out looking totally professional.

Reviews.Title: Better than my expectations. It's very good for travel and you don't worry about shocks, snows or rain
Reviews.Author: Julio César Martini
Reviews.Content: Great camera, nice photos , easy menu. Better than my expectations. It's very good for travel and you don't worry about shocks, snows or rain

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Asylums Dawn
Reviews.Content: It's even better then the last one i had. The macro is UNBELIEVABLE! It's has a lot of fancy options I'm not use to seeing in a Sony so that is a bonus. The touch screen has been flawless & the battery life is intense. I ordered this camera used and when I opened the box the battery had already been charged. I haven't had to charge it once since I got over a week ago. Even my old point and shoot would only last a day or two on stand by or a few hours when I was actively out taking pictures.I always test my waterproof cameras in the shower & this one had no leaks or fog up. :o)

Reviews.Title: The perfect purchase for mom
Reviews.Author: RogerM
Reviews.Content: Her last camera "drowned" in her purse when a water bottle opened accidentally. This small form camera is perfect for her and likely to survive another trip on the Camino de Santiago.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Cynthia P. Moore "FitterKnitter"
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best digital camera I have ever bought. Very small and good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Much improved from the TX-20
Reviews.Author: Osanan L. Barros "Sam Barros"
Reviews.Content: I owned a Sony DSC-TX10, which flooded during snorkeling 3 months later and was replaced for free, by Sony by a TX-20. The TX 20 lasted a year and then also flooded while snorkeling. Sony fixed that under warranty but it broke again close to a year later. By then the flimsy battery door had cracked in two different places. For the TX-30 Sony has done away with two doors and 3 gaskets separating the power connector, the A/V connector and the battery and put everything behind one single door, with one gasket underneath the camera. The door also appears to be much sturdier. The camera is overall smaller and "feels" higher quality than the previous models. The new screen is much sharper with brighter colors and it responds well to touch, even with a protective film. Quality remains what I would consider very good for a camera of this size. All in all, for $199 I don't think you can find a better waterproof point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Nice Upgrade
Reviews.Author: ST
Reviews.Content: Nice upgrade from the DSC-TX10 with more in camera features. I really like being able to make some editing changes to the pix directly from the camera. the touchscreen is more responsive and camera is overall easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Smith
Reviews.Content: I found this camera easy to use and it took really nice colorful underwater pictures, as well as pretty decent pictures on dry land. I like it!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Blane Fpx
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th sony over the yrs. they get smaller and better each yr. I had a previous tx and dropped it. this one is small, better optics, but is very slow processing each photo after it is taken. good in low light as well

Reviews.Title: Great camera, if you know how to use it!
Reviews.Author: Elisa and Teddy
Reviews.Content: Lots of great features, great display and image quality.  Battery lasts long, easy to transfer pics to PC and upload to fb.  This camera fits into every compartment wher eI normally keep my iPhone, almost same size.  Hubby bought it as a birthday gift for me and I am very happy!

Reviews.Title: Compact and made to withstand extreme conditions
Reviews.Author: Born to Shop!
Reviews.Content: The Sony DSC-TX30 is a terrific little camera for the sports enthusiasts to just casual photographer. So far we have tried it from the extreme like taking jump shots of our son doing BMX tricks on his bike, to cute pictures of our dogs sleeping in unusual positions. This camera offers easy touch setting for you to pick the right setting to get the right exposure and focus for environment you are in. How about correcting close-up images - Sony has you covered that as well. There is an option to correct blemishes and imperfections. There are so many options and modes to pick from.The camera is extremely lightweight and tiny, so it is a good thing that it is made to take a beating. I do believe that the touch screen will get scratched easily. I ended up cutting up one of my iPhone 5's screen protectors and applying it on the touch screen to protect it from the outdoor elements. Since this camera is made to be in extreme weather conditions from rain to snow and even underwater, there are going to be times it will be near abrasive substances such as rocks and sand. With the screen protector applied, the touch screen was still very responsive to my touch just like before.The camera fits perfectly in my hands. With patience and practice, you will learn which settings to use once you get the hang of them. I am still learning. The camera loses a star because the instruction booklet is worthless, and it does not come with a manual DVD so I am learning hands on as I use the camera. Battery life is okay, so I would recommend having an extra battery on hand Sony NPBN1 Sony NP-BN1 Replacement Batteries.Videos are saved using the AVCHD format.  You can download a basic very user friendly program called PlayMemories Home (link in owners manual) that will convert videos to WMV format.  There are so menus for editing photos and videos.  You can also post videos to social websites directly from this program.

Reviews.Title: Pocket Full of Fun
Reviews.Author: Never pay retail
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a feature packed, pocket sized go anywhere camera, this might just be the one for you.  Especially if, like me, "go anywhere" often involves kayaking,  hiking to waterfalls or other activities that can involve sudden exposure to water---like everyday living in Seattle.At first I was dismayed by the lack of a user manual.  Turns out it is all built into the camera.  Great if you want to learn about the features on the fly-not so good if you'd like to sit down and study up on it in advance without having to burn battery time.  Also, there is no photo editing software included.  They have a download link to "Play Memories" but that is more of a photo sharing site than editing.The camera itself is quite small.  The lens cover slides up and down on the front and also turns the camera on and off.  The LCD screen is big & clear and all of the menu settings are accessed through the touch screen interface.  Once you learn your favorite options, it's pretty quick to switch settings as needed.  There are many "artsy fartsy" picture effects to choose from.  Illustration and HDR Painting are my two favorites so far.  Handheld twilight does a nice job of capturing low light scenes.  The coolest thing is the panorama sweep.  Similar to what I've seen on an I phone, you just hold down the shutter and pan from left to right and automatically stitches it into a single panoramic shot.  On my computer, the panorama just shows like one long picture, but the camera can also play it like a mini movie clip and pans across the shot.I took this camera to Niagara Falls and it withstood both the Cave of the Winds and the Maid of the Mist.  The camera was soaked but preformed great and was even smart enough to focus on my subject not the drops of water on the lens.I have to say the picture quality is not as good as my Panasonic Lumix, nor does the zoom come anywhere close.  On the Panasonic's touch screen, I can tap the screen, set a focus point and take a picture all with one touch but if there is a way to do that on this Sony, I haven't found it yet.  But considering the small size and the fact that it's waterproof, these are acceptable tradeoffs depending on your end use for the photo.  If you print your pictures and need super high resolution, you might not be happy.  If you want something so tough and small that you will be sure to have it with you to capture the moment for You Tube or e-mail, you can't go wrong with this little Sony.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: lejo206
Reviews.Content: Wow, incredible. We loved it. We take si much pictures even underwater and the quality is excellent. Thankyou very much.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: Lisa Sharenbrock
Reviews.Content: I was hoping this camera would take better quality photos.  I am a professional photographer who was looking for a simple camera just to take everyday photos (ones that I will not publish/print on a large scale).  I was attracted to it because it was water proof.  It is an okay camera.  Way overpriced for what you get.  Focus is the good.

Reviews.Title: My fave!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Claure
Reviews.Content: Me and the bf bought this before we went on a cruise! It works so well underwater! We took a bunch of pics of coral and fish at St. Thomas island. Just a tip- just make sure you are always rinsing it off with water esp if you use it at the beach so sand doesn't get wedged in.

Reviews.Title: Much better than the previous camera (DSC-TX10)
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: It's the first time I make a review about a product that I purchased online. My first camera was the DSC-TX10 and to be honest, is excellent.  But definitely this Sony DSC-TX30 has surpassed all my expectations. Images are sharp, excellent quality and many features. Beautiful pictures, amazing features, colors are exceptional and every photo I take it justice that specific moment. The landscapes are wonderful, but underwater pictures are fantastic, with incredible precision and clarity. This camera is definitely an option you should take into consideration, espeacially for those who are looking for quality, price and comfort. Highly recommended, no regrets, I promise. I have uploaded pictures that prove all of the above

Reviews.Title: Awesome waterproof camera.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great small waterproof camera. Takes the work out of making pictures beautiful. 18MP is plenty for most all users. Works well in the water, even with the touch screen. All pros with only a couple cons: The on/off button is close to the shutter button and the slide down cover can be in the way at times....neither of these should keep you from buying this camera. We used it in the Caribbean and it took amazing pictures! The colors and clarity were some of the best I've seen. It works great in the water and has so many features you'll find everything you're looking for in this camera. Buy it!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Robust Camera
Reviews.Author: Anthony Montoya
Reviews.Content: My company uses these cameras for field work in the mining and metallurgical processing industry. These cameras hold up well in both wet and dusty environments all the while taking excellent quality photos and video. The new image stabilization feature works well, great for taking pictures of moving objects and pictures while the camera is moving.I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera to take absolutely anywhere!
Reviews.Author: Adara14
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera. I think it is the best little hardcore camera out.I bought this camera in June for a trip to Madagascar so that we could take snorkelling photos. Decided that my SLR was just too risky to lug around on a boat etc (and heavy for backpacking!). I did a LOT of research trying to find a camera that was definitely going to stay waterproof and not fail after one dunking leaving me with no pictures. Decided on this one (which had then just been released) as the few reviews indicated no function problems underwater. Took just this little camera on holiday and got some incredible shots, especially underwater! The features are really great (watercolour options, pop colour, panoramas, movies etc) and all worked really well for me. It is really really easy to use (I have never used an easier camera), as there are almost no buttons everything is touch screen and very user friendly. The screen can be a bit tricky to see in high light, but I have managed fine despite this.I'm no pro photographer, I just enjoy taking pics, so not sure how other people would find this, but I got some really great photos (in my opinion). You do have to watch the back screen for scratching and keep your fingers out the way of the lens, but it's beautifully made otherwise and a perfect size to take everywhere (fits in pockets easily). Battery life is fairly good, takes about 250 photos with special options used on some of them, haven't had problems with that though as I charged it each day. Obviously all reviews are subject to personal opinion, but I really love this little thing, I take it everywhere. Just took it to Greece as well and again used the underwater photos etc and again, photos look good. Maybe not always slr quality, but pretty good all the same, and often takes high colour really well (ie sunsets, water colours, etc). So a great practical all round camera if you just want some nice pics with no fuss.Also a note, in Madagascar somebody had a brand new Nikon AW110, and it didn't make it past 1 underwater photo!!! And never charged again either...so glad I listened to other reviews with same problems and didnot go for the Nikon. Seem highly unreliable underwater. I can with full confidence say the Sony has been underwater with me at least 30 times now with never a single issue! I do rinse it off and dry it after every use though just to be safe.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera!!!
Reviews.Author: N. Scherenberg "xajide"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a camping trip and it's performed beautifully.The area I stayed in had only freshwater so I cannot comment on the performance in salwater or sand but for my purposes, it did exactly what I needed it to do.I was taking pictures in the water, under water, would point the camera to shore, take pictures there... and they all came out great.The touch-screen functions started working right away once I picked the camera out of the water and it dried off pretty quickly after being submerged.Film quality was good and the different settings worked well. I've owned many small Sony cameras and also own a Sony Alpha.Their cameras usually perform extremely well and this one's no exception.Of course the picture quality cannot hold up to the same standards of an SLR camera but I definitely think this is one of the best quality images you can find in a point and shoot.My only gripe: The touch screen already has a big fat scratch on it. It seems extremely sensitive and I definitely think they could use some sort of tempered glass for an application that will see this much action.However, the touch function doesn't seem to suffer from the scrape so I'm not too bummed about it.The good news is: It's so tiny that even if I buy a cover for it, it'll still easily slide into my purse.Would definitely recommend this camera to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: Movie downloading issues
Reviews.Author: Katiebird
Reviews.Content: Be sure your computer is compatible with the camera to download the videos. It is a challenge to say the least to get it onto my PC, and I am told next to impossible to get them downloaded to my Mac.

Reviews.Title: 3.5 Stars- Very Portable But Picture Quality is Subpar For the Price
Reviews.Author: FirePepper Red "firepepper red"
Reviews.Content: The Sony TX30 is a very portable and rugged camera that is plagued with compromises.  The first thing you notice is the very small size.  While this is great for portability it makes it difficult to hold the camera in a way that feels natural. To make matters worse, the lens is on the upper left side right where your finger wants to be.  There is no grip on the camera which makes it easy to drop (thank goodness for the included wrist strap).  The few buttons that are on the camera are tiny and hard to differentiate from each other.  Most of the controls for the camera are buried in menus on the touchscreen.  While this is not always bad, in the case of the TX 30 it is frustrating since you cannot read the screen in bright sunlight.  To make matters worse the picture quality is not up to par with the price of the camera.  The photos tend to have noise even in bright light and low ISO.  What this means is that your photos will have a graininess to them which is very noticeable if you magnify the images on your computer.  Most people who print 4x6 photos will probably not notice but if you ever need to enlarge a photo it will become apparent.*** Positive Points: ***- Very Portable and easy to carry- Slide down lens is easy to operate and hides the lens when not in use- Touchscreen is easy to use and has good resolution- Can be charged by included wall adapter or the USB cable- Uses a micro usb charging tip which makes it easy to find a replacement charging adapter in case you lose the original charger- 5x zoom is really incredible considering the size of the camera- Can use Sony Memory Stick Micro or Micro SD*** Negative Points: ***- Photos have a lot of noise (graininess) even in bright light- The buttons/menus are hidden and hard to decipher if you have never used the camera- Zoom lever is tiny and frustrating to use (especially for accurate zooming)- Touchscreen is very hard to read in bright sunlight and you can forget about adjusting the options when it is bright outside- The waterproof seal is around the bottom of the case which holds the battery, memory card, and  all the ports.  You must open the bottom case every time you want to charge the battery which can eventually wear down the seal.- Menus are not easy to decipher and simple functions such as forced on for flash are not available in all modes*** Overall:*** The Sony is a very portable camera that has made many compromises for its small size and ruggedness. If you can live with the ergonomic compromises and sub-par picture quality then this may be the right fit for you, for most people there are better cameras available for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the amateur!
Reviews.Author: Denise Crawford "DC"
Reviews.Content: When I got this camera, I was excited about its potential -- especially because of its advertised resistance to water. My initial disappointment was that the camera had NO internal memory and I had no micro SD memory card. I was able to take only 7 pictures before the display told me I had to delete shots as memory was full. I honestly wish that the SD card had been included with the camera and that it just cost a little more than to have to go and buy one to be able to use the camera. After I got the required memory, I played with it a little to make sure I could use some of the main features I loved the panoramic capability and the point and shoot was intuitive and easy to figure out. The touchscreen is easy to see except in bright sunlight, and responsive to touch. The picture quality was fairly good but definitely need a flash on for the lower light situations. The zoom works great and its simple to get the shot you want. I did find that taking photos of more distant lighted objects at night (a giant scoreboard for example) was not possible. The camera does well with close up still shots in good light but not so well with motion. The photos I took of family on amusement rides were blurry. I figure some of this is due to operator error and I really need more time and more conditions to play around with the settings. I'm also eager to print out some of the better photos and see how well they adapt to enlargement.Overall, I really like the camera. I've been using it in and around a swimming pool with no ill effects but have not tried any underwater shots yet. I did get a case for the camera to protect the glass touchscreen. My previous camera was also a Sony and I think the company makes a solid product. I do like how small it is. I have not yet tested battery life or transferred pictures to my computer. I think I'll get a great deal of use out of it when traveling and at special occasions.

Reviews.Title: Very portable with good picture quality
Reviews.Author: Randal E. Bryant
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an alternative to lugging along a DSLR.  I wanted good picture quality (both high resolution and good low-light performance), a reasonable zoom, and portability (both small size and rugged.)  Overall, it's met all of these objectives.  Haven't tried submerging it in water yet, but I like the idea that it won't get damaged if it falls in the water.I like the way the cover slides back to expose the lens.  I have had other point-and-shoot cameras with exposed lenses, and they tended to get dirty--pocket fuzz & fingerprints.There are many options and controls. It's mostly based on the touch screen, which means lots of fishing through menus.  Giving up an optical viewfinder makes it pretty much impossible to see what you're shooting when in the bright sun.  These limitations are the price you pay for the small size, and so I really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Delivered as promised
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I won't know how it performs until I've used it for a while, but it was delivered as promised. I can say that the zoom button was placed too closely to the corner of the camera -- as a camera for active use, that makes the camera harder to hold on to.

Reviews.Title: just convinient for take photo
Reviews.Author: QJ "Una"
Reviews.Content: it is ok for people that needs convinient............ it is cheap when i buy it. i bought it for 190 dollars

Reviews.Title: keep coming back to this camera
Reviews.Author: A. Kim
Reviews.Content: i had the original DSC tx10, and really liked it.  afterwards had a waterproof oly, nikon, and pany.  i ended up returning the oly and pany due to faults.  the oly did take wonderful photos.  but i think this sony does almost the same, and the video is much superior.  i also like that its in mp4 format vs avchd (lite).in the end, its a point and shoot.  i havent had issues with it in the water at the beach, waves, or at swimming lessons with the little one (though with the tx10 it get water in when i dove too deep, and ended up with a slow death).it can be fiddly with the all touchscreen sometimes, and the microphone placement is not ideal.  but i will use it for the next years, and then prob buy the next model in the line.  stick with what works.

Reviews.Title: great performance
Reviews.Author: Ben Nizar
Reviews.Content: Simply the best camera that is waterproof, i tested it and it takes excellent photos, i bought it to sell it but i ended up keeping it for myself

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Maria Martinez
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's compact, it takes beautiful crisp pictures and has wonderful features! Totally recommend it to all my family and friends!

Reviews.Title: Waterproof
Reviews.Author: loc tran
Reviews.Content: Nice slim camera that we used for the ocean in Hawaii.  It was very sharp and clear and I would recommend it to anybody who wants to use it for underwater.

Reviews.Title: Clear, crisp pictures
Reviews.Author: BeckiTravels
Reviews.Content: This camera was replacing an OLD Olympus underwater camera.  This takes great pictures under water, though I miss the 20x zoom capability of ly "land" Sony.

Reviews.Title: Amazing pocket camera!
Reviews.Author: Rich H. "Old Pro"
Reviews.Content: I am an expert photographer, with Leica Digital M cameras and lenses for my "fine" work.  But when I dropped my G9 into a tiny creek and ruined it I needed to replace it with a waterproof camera; also better for my fly fishing vest.  I am absolutely stunned by the picture quality of this tiny device. I don't prefer the lack of a viewfinder, or dial controls, but leaving the settings on auto/auto, and the format on 4X3, it becomes simple to use.  The zoom range is perfect, and Zeiss is commended for creating such quality and precision in a lense that would easily fit in a smart phone!  That it lacks a 24X36 format option is my only serious complaint...however, the resolution is so good that I can crop in I Photo with no noticeable loss of image quality.  It is a bargain at Amazon's price, and a better camera than my G9 ever was. APPLE needs to take note of the pure technology in this device.  Mine has the prestige of resting in my Leica's Billingham accessory pouch.

Reviews.Title: Good waterproof camera for outdoors
Reviews.Author: Big D
Reviews.Content: We got this camera for outdoor hiking trips.  It is nice and compact.  Always spring for the Carl Zeiss lens on a Sony camera as it is a great improvement over the standard lens.  It has a small internal memory space so get a micro SDHC memory card to go with it.

Reviews.Title: This is a great service camera for someone in my profession..
Reviews.Author: AZ Ahmed
Reviews.Content: Seafood Sales.It works great for those close up product shots, which can be used with a sales pitch. If the camera get soiled, smells fishy, just wash it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - Tiny - Solid - Great VIDEO
Reviews.Author: GenericName
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I can't say enough good things about it. It's size and durability are incredible and I'm so happy it charges off of a standard mirco USB charger. I wish all mobile devices used this standard charging.The sliding cover is an intuitive way to wake up the camera. I wish more cameras utilized this system.It's hard to believe how good the video is considering the size.I would get an extra battery or two, but other than that, enjoy!I also own the tx20. This one is better but if price is an issue then the tx20 is also good.

Reviews.Title: The TX30 beats the WX10.
Reviews.Author: MLouise
Reviews.Content: About two years ago I purchased the Sony Cybershot DSC-WX10. I loved it (still do) and gave it glowing reviews. So when I had the opportunity to try the DSC-TX30 I jumped on it.I only found one negative, but I'll discuss the positives first. Basically, I look for three things in a camera; photo quality, ease of use, and battery life. This camera excels in all three areas. As far as quality goes, it is very similar to my old Cybershot with one difference. The depth of field is much better with this WX10. I took identical close up photos of flowers in my yard with both cameras for comparisons. The close up sharpness was similar in both photos, but the background with this camera was substantially sharper. The background with the old camera was quite blurry and I may not have realized it if I didn't have the new one for comparison. I used a variety of settings on each camera for comparison, and no matter what setting I used, the background was always more clear in the new camera. (I did not try the setting for background 'defocus' because it just wasn't that kind of photo.)As far as ease of use goes, I was surprised at how user friendly this camera is. I am used to dials and knobs, but the touch screen is so intuitive that I did not have to look at the manual at all. I was able to scroll through a ton of features even more easily than with my old camera. The simplicity of use will encourage me to actually USE many more features than I've ever used before with photos. I especially like the one called 'pop color'. It makes it so you don't have to adjust saturation in photoshop. I have had every picture turn out perfect so far when using that feature.I also love indoor photos with this camera. The lighting is somehow automatically fixed, even with sun coming in windows. And of course, the panoramic feature is wonderful. As a Montana gal, I have lots of sweeping views that I like to capture!I don't know how long the battery will last, but it has not run out yet. I can't say how many photos I have taken because I deleted all the 'just for practice & comparison' pics. But it has been a lot and I still have over 1/2 my battery left.Ok, now for my negative...I really, really dislike the way the battery/card compartment door closes. Like most cameras, there is a spring type button you push back to open it. When you close it, you need to hold the spring loaded button back while you push the door closed and then release the button. There are two issues with this. First, when you push the door closed, you need to push down right on the very end of the door or it won't close. If you push down in the same area as the button, it won't close. (The button and the end of the door are about 1/4" apart.) Second, you need to make sure the button is slid back all the way, and hold it there while you push on the end of the door to close it. If you don't have the button slid back all the way, then the little catch-tab that sticks out will be revealed and it is SOOoooo thin and delicate looking that it looks like it could break if you're not really careful. I personally, am very careful.Although this is a negative for me, I love the other features so much that it didn't warrant taking away a whole star.So there you have it. I will continue to explore this great little camera and will add more info if I find reason to.

Reviews.Title: Long time Sony fan is disappointed with this one
Reviews.Author: Gina B. "It's a dry heat!"
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time Sony fan and almost all my many cameras are Sony brand - including my Sony NEX-6L/B 16.1 MP Compact Interchangeable Lens Digital Camera with 16-50mm Power Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LED (Black), which I adore.I had high hopes for this little camera - but there are some serious flaws as to why I can't continue using it.CONS:First, the touch screen is so soft that it became majorly scratched the first week I used it.  This is not Gorilla Glass like on your cell phone!  You need to get a screen protector on it before you even start using it if you want the screen to stay nice.  I was really surprised how easily the screen scratched.I was disappointed to find that they have only built in a micro SD slot instead of a full size slot (that will also fit micros) - and that is disappointing since the camera does not have wifi.  I'm a fan of Eye-Fi Connect X2 4 GB Class 6 SDHC Wireless Flash Memory Card EYE-FI-4CN and use them in all my cameras and devices at home, but alas, they are only full sized SDs.Lastly, the slide up and down front lens cover is very flimsy and really not needed.  They should have just designed a small sliding cover for the lens, not had the entire front half of the camera open and close.PROS:The waterproof features work well and the pictures from the camera are as sharp as you'd expect from a folded optic device, but that in itself isn't enough to sell me on the camera.  As with most Sony's, the camera loves the color green and seems to weight this more heavily in shots with lots of grass, trees, etc - but this adds a vibrancy that I actually kind of like.  The camera also has several fun in-camera photo editing features (like whitening teeth, giving yourself a tan, making your eyes larger, and airbrushing).  It's also compact enough to bring along in your cargo shorts pocket or in a purse - it's lightweight with ample battery life for a day out.In my opinion this is a great secondary camera if you travel frequently - taking it on typical vacations where you'd leave your DSLR at home is fantastic.  However, if you're looking for an all-around compact that you can take everywhere ... look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC
Reviews.Author: A. Reader
Reviews.Content: To be clear this camera is waterproof to 30 ft and shockproof. It takes all the best features of last years waterproof Sony Camera and there non waterproof one and combines them into a smaller more robust bigger sensor-ed package.Some things to note: there are tougher waterproof cameras out there. I'm partial to the Panasonic TS' for all around toughness, but you will be hard pressed to find a smaller or sleeker one. As part of that sleekness though, you have to rely on a touch screen for all settings. Lastly there are a ton of artsy settings for your photos. I never use any of them. I think all changes are better made on a computer where you can really manipulate images.Pros: Great pictures for a point and shoot, tough, bright screen, fits in just about any pocket. I love the slide to turn on and off and that it protects the lens. Also it charges via a usb cord so you dont have to bring a battery charger with you.Cons: No GPS (not a feature I love but standard on most rugged cameras), screen cant be used with gloves making setting changes tough in the cold, uses expensive micro SD cards. Zoom and shutter can be tough to manipulate with ski type gloves (doable, but hard.)All in all I love this camera and it is my go to P&S; camera. Butttt people see the 18.1mega pixels and assume that gives it DSLR like abilities. IT DOES NOT SHOOT LIKE A DSLR OR 4/3. The sensor is considerably smaller meaning your dark shots will never be fantastic. You can never manually focus (though it does have a feature that blurs the background.) The ISO gets noisier much faster. The pictures take longer to shoot. However if the best camera is the one you have with you, than this might very well be the best camera there is. You can use it in most any environment you find yourself in, and it fits easily into any pocket or purse to the point you'll forget its there. And its still taking much better pictures than my iphone 5 and in environs that I might not want to take out my non waterproofed phone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: Curtis Warnasch
Reviews.Content: Image quality equal to my SONY DCS HX30v. Improved zoom for a compact camera. Fits well in pockets. Quick video record and save compared to TX10

Reviews.Title: Wonderful purchase
Reviews.Author: Tam_I_am
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter who is going on a cruise over Christmas.  I got it for her birthday.  It was exactly what she wanted and she is really looking forward to using it on the cruise.

Reviews.Title: Great worry free camera
Reviews.Author: T. Randall
Reviews.Content: Pictures taken with this camera are clear and full of depth. Add to that the ability to shoot underwater and you have the ideal camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Susant
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a vacation trip to the Bahamas.  We took stills, video, underwater, and panoramas.  Picture quality is fantastic, even from a moving boat.  The LED display is a little challenging to read in the sun and scratches easily, and I couldn't ever find an underwater mode choice in the menu (instructions don't match available screens), but all-in-all it is a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Super compact - waterproof beautiful photos
Reviews.Author: Zeb "zebra01"
Reviews.Content: The camera does a fantastic job in regular lighting as well as low light conditions and has a very nice color balance at its default settings. Its basic shooting mode covers most general needs and the ability to just touch the object on screen you want it to focus on and have it hold onto that object as you zoom and pan works very nicely.The build quality is very nice and the slide open shutter works easily and automatically turns the camera on allowing you to work the camera one handed with ease. The movie mode with image stabilization smoothes out slight movements very nicely, and the dedicated movie button allows easy access to the movie mode without needing to use the menu which is helpful.I only tested briefly underwater but it seemed to work fine. I did unintentionally test the shockproof feature when I dropped it onto concrete from about 5 feet high and it suffered no ill effects, you can't even see a scrape on it.There is more of a delay than I was expecting between pictures, there is around a second lag between shots, and a little more so if its a low light exposure. In practice I very rarely found this to be noticeable, but compared to other non-waterproof cameras I have used it was noticeably longer.Overall its a very nice camera, has a beautiful screen for viewing pictures, and takes a very nice picture, the menus take a little getting used to and the shutter lag is something to be aware of, but its a great camera for taking high quality pictures without having to lug around a DLSR when you still want a high quality photo.

Reviews.Title: Just a thought about Sony cameras.
Reviews.Author: J. Tsai
Reviews.Content: I want to clarify before I post this review. This is based off of my experiences with the DSC-TX20, not the DSC-TX30, but may reflect upon Sony's customer service and product design. Hopefully it is something to consider when purchasing this camera.I bought the Sony DSC-TX20 in December of 2012. Used it in Hawaii in January and used it again in the pool in June of 2013. I only used it twice, and always made sure the camera seals were completely clean before immersion. I've used Canon products underwater before and am familiar with proper care and use of underwater cameras.When I used it in the pool, the seal somehow failed and allowed a little water into the camera. Even though I was not near the maximum depth for the camera, some water got into the camera and it stopped working. Again, prior to immersion, I had checked the seals and ensured that the openings had positively latched.After I sent it into Sony, their customer service center informed that it was not covered by warranty due to corrosion in the camera. Their explanation was that it was "uneconomical to fix the camera, so the warranty was void." To me, this is completely illogical and unfair. Not only could they not tell me how the cameras were tested to see if there was a seal or product failure, two of the four people I was transferred to were somewhat rude. The third, who supposedly worked for the national customer service center, ended up telling me that she was going to transfer me to the tech center that had the unit in hand and were the ones that tested it. She ended up transferring me to the first unit. The final individual was rude and told me he couldn't transfer me to anyone, or back to the original unit. I was told, again, that because there was corrosion in the camera, they would not honor the warranty. They could not seem to understand that the water and corrosion in the camera was because of a product defect.So, I'm out the price of the camera after two uses, including warranty shipping back to the Sony customer service center. I've been a long fan and customer of Sony products, but this has definitely turned me off. I would highly recommend against this camera, and, after the customer service experience, against Sony cameras at the very least.

Reviews.Title: Flimsy - inner screen cracked within a week
Reviews.Author: Phillip North "Phil"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a multi-layered display screen and the inner screen cracked. It had not been dropped, just got a big crack along the bottom corner which can be seen clearly under the outer layer of glass.It doesn't seem to impact waterproofing but doesn't look great.  Other features seem fine but for a camera that is meant to be ruggedised this is a fail.I have previously had Panasonic rugged cameras which have been used mountain biking, run over by vehicles and dropped onto rocks without problem.  This camera was for a tourist trip to NYC and Hawaii. Didn't stand up to the rough and tumble of a padded case in a padded backpack.Get an Olympus or Panasonic if you are doing anything outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera for the beach, rain, and storms
Reviews.Author: Sukru Tikves
Reviews.Content: This camera is an incremental update of Sony's TX20, with higher resolution, deeper zoom, and larger screen. It's a solid device that handles near (or in) water situations very well.Although Sony has manged to place a 5x zoom optical assembly in a small space, of course it's no match regular point and shoots (never mind the DSLRs). It's a tradeoff of the waterproof design, and the camera tries to compensate for it by extra image processing. I could say it works, at least for me. It shoots triple images in succession to make up for the optics, and generally it produced very good results, even in really low light conditions.The touchscreen UI takes some time to get used to, however it feels at home after a day or so. The overall feature set is similar to recent Sony cameras including face and child face detection, 3D shots, panoramas, photo effects, and burst shots.As people have pointed out THERE IS NO 8GB INTERNAL MEMORY. Unfortunately the Amazon description is incorrect (Sony's website does not have this error).My actual complaint is the lack of a GPS receiver. Since the camera cannot take full size SD cards, even a third party solution like Eye-Fi would not work. Many other competitors - and even some of Sony's own products have this feature, and it's very helpful in organizing trip photos.If you're looking for a solid camera to shoot at the beach, during the rain, or stormy conditions, this is a very good choice. If you're looking for a general purpose one, of course there are more cost effective options.

Reviews.Title: camara case  sony dsc tx30/b ?
Reviews.Author: Ernesto
Reviews.Content: Dear amazon ; On August first 2013 I purchased the camara  Sony DSC-TX30/B 18 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized  I received all the products I ordered (thanks) but the camara case that its been promised. Per add says; Buy a Select Point-and-Shoot Camera, Get a Free AmazonBasics Case Receive a free Amazon  Basics compact camera case with the purchase of this camera. Offer valid through August 31st, 2013, or while supplies last. Applies only to purchases of products sold by Amazon.com. so when will I receive my camera case ? thanks ... E.S.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pictures taken with this camera.
Reviews.Author: Luis Omar
Reviews.Content: Ideal for traveling and everyday use. Highly recommended to everyone looking to take perfect pictures without the need to carry heavy DSLR cameras.

Reviews.Title: Sleek form factor that's waterproof and shoots 1080p video!
Reviews.Author: R. Hammer "rhammer"

Reviews.Title: The Sony TX7 is a far better alternative and more affordable
Reviews.Author: M. Gehret "G-Man  Colorado"
Reviews.Content: Compared to the Sony TX7,  this is pretty much that same camera, only smaller, lighter, eats batteries, and is far more expensive. The only good is that its moisture and dust proof. I wouldnt trust this camera under water. They just don't make these cameras to be submerged and actually last without later issues and anger by the user. the Sony TX7 has far superior sound, is larger with bigger screen and better made.

Reviews.Title: Cheated by Amazon
Reviews.Author: Niraj
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because Amazon said it comes with 8 GB internal memory but actually it do not have any internal memory. I took 2 pics and it says memory full.Camera is good but only disadvantage it does not have any internal memory.

Reviews.Title: falsely advertised
Reviews.Author: Khaldia
Reviews.Content: Amazon states camera comes with 8gb of memory when in actuality it only holds 42mb of memory.I loved the camera, that is why it is receiving 3 stars and not 5.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof is the Key...Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Technology X
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for the wife and we loved it so much we did a complete review found here..Enjoy![...]
